gurmukhi: ilAwvhu cMfI bwND ky nwqr fwroN mwr ]107]
transliteration: Liaavoh Channdoo Baandh Ke Naatar Ddaron Maar||107||
translation: “Arrest and bring Chandi otherwise kill her.”107.

gurmukhi: kop cVy rn cMf Aau muMf su lY cqurMgn sYn BlI ]
transliteration: Kop Chaderan Channd Au Mounnd Su Lai Chaturanad Sain Bhaloo||
translation: Chand and Mund, with great ire, marched towards the battlefield, alongwith four types of fine army.

gurmukhi: qb sys ky sIs Drw lrjI mn miD qrMgin nwv hlI ]
transliteration: Tab Ses Ke Soos Dharaa Larjoo Man Madh(i) Taranad(i) Naav Haloo||
translation: At that time, the earth shook on the head of Sheshnaga like the boat in the stream.

gurmukhi: Kur bwjn DUr aufI niB ko kiv ko mn qy aupmw n tlI ]
transliteration: Khur Baajan Dhoor Udoo Nabh(i) Ko Kav(i) Ke Man Te Oupmaa Na Taloo||
translation: The dust which rose towards the sky with the hooves of the horses, the poet firmly imagined in his mind;

gurmukhi: Bv Bwr Apwr invwrn kO DrnI mno bHm ky lok clI ]108]
transliteration: Bhav Bhaar Apaar Nivaaran Kau Dharnoo Mano Brahm Ke Lok Chaloo||108||
translation: That the earth is going towards the city of God in order to supplicate for the removal of its enormous burden.108.

gurmukhi: cMf muMf dYqn duhUM sbl pRbl dl lIn ]
transliteration: Channd Mounnd Daitan Duhoon Sabal Prabal Dal Loon||
translation: Both the demons Chand and Mund took a great army of warriors with them.

gurmukhi: inkit jwie igr Gyir kY mhw kulwhl kIn ]109]
transliteration: Nikattee Jaae Gir Gher(i) Kai Mahaa Kulaahal Koon(109)
translation: On reaching near the mountain, they besieged it and raised great furore.109.

gurmukhi: jb kwn sunI Duin dYqn kI qb kopu kIE igrjw mn mY ]
transliteration: Jab Kaan Sounoo Dhoun(i0 Daitan Koo Tab Kop(u) Ko( i)  Girjaa Man Mai||
translation: When the goddess heard the tumult of demons, she was filled with great rage in her mind.

gurmukhi: cV isMG su sMK bjwie clI siB AwXuD Dwr qbY qn mY ]
transliteration: Chad Singh Su Sankh Bajaae Chaloo Sabh(i) Aayudh Dhaar Tabai Tan Main
translation: She moved immediately, riding on her lion, blowing her conch and carrying all the weapons on her body.

gurmukhi: igr qy auqrI dl bYrn ky pr XON aupmw aupjI mn mY ]
transliteration: Girt E Outroo Dal Bairan Ke Par Yaoun Oupmaa Oupjoo Man Mai||
translation: She descended from the mountain on the forces of the enemy and the poet felt;

gurmukhi: nB qy bhrI lK CUt prI jnu kUk kulMgn ky gn mY ]110]
transliteration: Nabh Te Bahroo Lakh Chhodht Daroo Jan(u) Kook Kulanad Keg An Mai||110||
translation: That the falcon hath swooped down from the sky on the flock of cranes and sparrows.110.
